medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressively worsening epistaxis and abdominal distension
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced a 2-year history of on-and-off spontaneous epistaxis, progressively worsening in the last two weeks with up to 4 episodes per day. This was associated with an 8-month history of increasing abdominal distension and mild pain. The epistaxis was preceded by sharp frontal throbbing headaches. During this period, the patient also developed on-and-off low-grade fevers, severe headaches, palpitations, dizziness, and general malaise.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Three admissions in the previous year managed for malaria without blood transfusion. Underwent splenectomy 6 months prior to current presentation due to worsening hematological parameters.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of a similar condition.
